notesStmt.note: Title from third line of text (f. 1r); alternate title Ajapājapa from marginal note, bottom left (f. 1v)
Incipit: (f. 1r): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ prāṇāyāmaṁ kṛtvā adya sūryodayād ārabhya śvaḥ sūryodayaparyaṁtaṁ ṣaṭśatādhikam ekaviṁśatisahasrasaṁkhyākaḥ ajapāgāyatrīmantrasya
Explicit: (f. 1v): brahmaraṁdhre guruṁ dhyātvā gurave sahasraṁ nivedayāmi evaṁ samarpayet
Dated 13 śuklapakṣa of Āśvīna, śaka 1769 (Friday, October 22, 1847, f. 1v).
One mistake blotched out with black.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Mantra and breath exercise called ajapājapa; starts with the practice of the three common breath exercises (prāṇāyāma) and especially focuses on the mantra haṃsa.
